newsitem.title: USA: Charles Schwab says Q2 revs could be lower.
newsitem.headline: Charles Schwab says Q2 revs could be lower.

text.p: Charles Schwab Corp said Wednesday its second quarter revenues and profit margins would be "modestly" lower than those of the first quarter if retail customer trading activity remains at the March level.
The first two months of the year showed record trading volumes and strong market returns in securities markets, it said, but the market weakened in March.

"Since we currently view the unsettled market environment as temporary, we intend to continue our practice of aggressively investing throughout most market cycles," Chairman Charles Schwab said in a statement.

"If we experience an extended slowdown, we will adjust our expenses accordingly, with the expectation that we would return to generating margins comparable to those achieved over the last few years," he said.
